page.title: 04High Marnham Power Station
page.content: High Marnham Power Station was the first one to built in this country with an output of 1000 MWs which was enough electricity to meet the needs of 1,000,000 people.Work began on building in November 1955 and the first electricity was produced in 1959.The station was completed in 1962 at a cost of Â£50million.It is sited in the ideal spot to use coal from the East Midlands Coalfield and on the bank of the Trent which provides water for the cooling system.Although some agricultural land was lost in the building of the station,a much larger area has been returned to agriculture by filling in derelict gravel pitswith waste ash which is piped 5 miles across the Trent.A suspension foot bridge has been built to enable workers to gain easy access to the Station from the east of the Trent.
